title: KHR_materials_specular glTF extension
description: glTF extension that defines the strength of the specular reflection.

specularFactor.description: The strength of the specular reflection.
specularFactor.gltf_detailedDescription: This parameter scales the amount of specular reflection on non-metallic surfaces. It has no effect on metals.

specularColorFactor.description: The F0 RGB color of the specular reflection.
specularColorFactor.gltf_detailedDescription: This is an additional RGB color parameter that tints the specular reflection of non-metallic surfaces. At grazing angles, the reflection still blends to white, and the parameter has not effect on metals. The value is linear.

specularTexture.description: An RGBA texture that defines the F0 color of the specular reflection encoded in sRGB and the specular factor.
specularTexture.gltf_detailedDescription: Either a 4-channel texture that defines the specular color in the RGB channels and the specular factor in the alpha channel, a 3-channel texture that defines only the specular color, a 2-channel texture that defines a grayscale specular color and specular factor, or a 1-channel texture that defines a grayscale specular color. Will be multiplied by specularFactor and/or specularColorFactor.

specularTextureType.description: Defines the type of the specular texture

anyOf.description: The specular texture has 4 channels. The specular color factor is stored in the RGB channels. The specular factor is stored in the A channel.
The specular texture has 3 channels and stores the specular color factor.
The specular texture has 2 channels. The grayscale specular color factor is stored in the L channel. The specular factor is stored in the A channel.
The specular texture has 1 channel and stores a grayscale specular color factor.
